result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert L Wagner

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Robert L Wagner not in court.  Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court for Robert L Wagner.  Attorney Alexander James Geocaris in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO  JUDGE. No action on bail.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Robert L Wagner appeared by video.  Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke appeared by video for Robert L Wagner.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 

Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Greendale PD Detective J. Barth. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 11.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Robert L Wagner in court, appear by video.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Attorney Lamke to be appointed pending a conflit check. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 07-16-2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with J.K. and Co-Defendants Chase Cherry including D.R.

Defendant Robert L Wagner in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge John Franke.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7/14/22 @ 1:30p
